New Records: Rohit Sharma broke the tie with Glenn Maxwell and Suryakumar Yadav to record his fifth T20I century in 64 balls
Rohit Sharma and Rinku Singh's 190-run partnership is the highest for India in T20Is for any wicket, surpassing Sanju Samson and Deepak Hooda's 176
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma and Rinku Singh's 190-run partnership
Afghanistan openers Rahmanullah Gurbaz and Ibrahim Zadran put on 93 from 11 overs
Gulbadin Naib and Mohammad Nabi's cameos almost flattened the host
Virat Kohli's stellar leap at long-on in the 17th over to turn a potential six into a single
Post-Match Reflections: Ravi Bishnoi claimed both wickets to help India sweep the series 3-0
Rohit Sharma expressed pride in the team's resilience after a close win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match went into two Super Overs, a first in T20Is
India scored 11 for two in the second Super Over, while Afghanistan was shot out for one run
The match was a topsy-turvy affair with ebbs and flows like an ocean wave on a full moon day
